brawler.desc: Even in a universe of talking apes and wormholes to other planets, there are always people who recognize the special skill set that goes along with a more physical bent. You've honed yourself to be able to take the greatest advantage of whatever physical gifts your morph or shell may have.

dilettante.desc: While you've never really stood out in any one area, you've always been able to competently perform just about any task you try.

extrovert.desc: Who needs to be tough when you can convince others to fight for you? Who needs brilliance, when smart people will fall over themselves to tell you everything they know just for a little more time with you?

inquisitive.desc: Your natural problem-solving and investigative bent means you often notice things others miss.

researcher.desc: Knowledge is power. The TITANs were little more than code-knowledge applied to the right places at the right time to produce power. You've dedicated yourself to a life of the mind for the benefits it brings.

survivor.desc: You may not be the smartest, strongest, or quickest, but you've always been able to pull it together and scrape by in a tough situation.

techie.desc: Understanding how things work gives you an edge when you need to understand how to stop them or make them work better. That's always been your gift: a way with applied information, be it computer code or life-support machinery.

thrill seeker.desc: You've never said no to a dare, and your quick reactions haven't failed you so far. You may not always make the best decisions, but you usually manage to land on your feet.

colonist command staff.desc: You helped run one of the pre-Fall colonies, whether it was in Earth orbit, on Luna or Mars, or elsewhere in the system.

colonist flight staff.desc: You worked on, or even piloted, the ships that kept colonies supplied.

colonist security staff.desc: You secured pre-Fall colonies, keeping the rabble in line and guarding against hostile elements.

colonist science staff.desc: You conducted scientific research off-world, whether that was studying the sun's solar cycles, evaluating lichen growth on Mars, or creating new zero-g manufacturing processes.

colonist tech staff.desc: You kept the colony in working order-a matter of survival more than convenience.

drifter.desc: You may be a Martian nomad, an original scum swarm pioneer, a free trader, or just a wanderer. Your people have always gone where the work was, first on Earth and then into space, where hands or your kind of skills were needed. You may not be as highly specialized as some people, but you know a little about a lot of things and have picked up what you need to get by.

earth survivor.desc: Unlike a small percentage of transhumanity, you did not escape off-world during the Fall, nor were you lucky enough to be killed. You survived for years, eking out an existence in the post-apocalyptic desolation of Earth while hiding from, and even fighting, the machines and twisted transhuman puppets that still lurked there. Only recently was your body rescued by scrappers or reclaimers or your egocast unwisely accepted by a trusting receiver.

fall evacuee enclaver.desc: You were one of the lucky ones who grew up in safety behind the walls and security systems that kept the masses of the poor out. When the Fall happened, your connections (or your family's) ensured you were one of the first to leave up the beanstalk.

fall evacuee underclass.desc: Most of those who survived made it off-planet either by virtue of their birth or earning their way into one of the enclaves. You were either lucky enough to be in the small percentage of non-elites to be evacuated or you managed to bribe, scam, or sneak your way past security during the Fall and secure a position on a shuttle or beanstalk car.

hyperelite media personality.desc: People know you. In fact, there's a good chance that they see you on a regular basis. You're an X-caster, a blogger, a  famous MARG gamer, a pundit, a performer, the spokesperson for a brand, an athlete, or some other form of celebrity.

hyperelite scion.desc: You were born into the wealth and privilege that financed transhumanity's expansion into space. It is your family name, rather than any talent or achievement, that makes you well known and in demand at social events.

indenture.desc: You either won a lottery for the poor, where the prize was to go off-world, or you died during the Fall. Either way, you found yourself working away in virtual slavery to a hypercorp. You worked hard constructing habitats, mining asteroids, or terraforming Mars.

infolife emergent uplift.desc: You were a smart program on the verge of emergence when the programmers reshaped you, encoded you with transhuman values and modes of thinking, and uplifted you to machine sapience. You possess a number of quirks that make you stand out from traditionally programmed AGIs.

infolife humanities agi.desc: You were designed to understand and interact with humans. Your programming is optimized for tasks such as personal assistance, marketing, caretaking, and psychology.

infolife machine agi.desc: What understands machines better than a machine mind? Your code is focused on interacting and controlling software and hardware so that humans don't have to.

infolife research agi.desc: Your software predecessors were programmed to gather and analyze data, assist in scientific projects, and conduct experiments on their own. AIs such as yourself are valued members of research projects, universities, and data analysis hypercorps.

isolate seperatist.desc: As happened many times throughout history, groups facing persecution fled to new territories where they could practice their beliefs in peace. You hail from one of these groups that traveled to the isolated reaches of the system to find a place they could worship, experiment, or simply exist away from prying or hostile neighbors. As a result of your peoples' self-imposed isolation, you've learned to be far more self-sufficient than most.

isolate survivalist.desc: Your family feared trouble on Earth, so they established a bunker off-world. They were right. Now they fear that trouble may return and engulf the entire solar system.

lost disturbed child.desc: The Lost project unwittingly created a generation of monsters. You are among the odd, deranged, twisted, psychotic, and powerful examples that escaped.

lost masked normalcy.desc: You survived the Lost project damaged but intact-or at least able to mask your inner demons from others. You are not as gifted-or as explosive-an async as some of the others, but you are also better at keeping yourself under control.

original scum.desc: More than just a drifter, you were a pioneer in the pursuit for morphological freedom.

reinstantiated civilian casualty.desc: You died during the Fall. Either the TITAN machines overwhelmed your area or you fell victim to transhumanity's  own use of WMDs or savage infighting. You might not even know how you died, as you were recovered from a backup transmitted off-world. However it went down, it wasn't an experience you'd care to repeat. Luckily, you were  resleeved quickly.

reinstantiated infomorph.desc: After your death during the Fall, you spent a substantial period of time in VR worlds before you were eventually resleeved.

reinstantiated military casualty.desc: You were killed during the Fall. You may have fallen during a sneak attack, died fighting the TITAN machines on the front lines, or even been murdered by fellow humans as you tried to keep order in transhumanity's darkest hours. At least your sacrifice was rewarded by a quick resleeving.

street rat.desc: You were raised in a gang, syndicate family, or cartel workforce. You are used to the ways of violence and routing around the law.

uplift escapee.desc: Though you are as intelligent as a human, you were born and raised as a second-class citizen, corporate property, or worse: a test subject. Somehow you escaped or were liberated, and now you try to find yourself in a galaxy that often seems out to get you.

uplift feral.desc: The uplift process did not 'humanize' you as much as other uplifts. Your natural instincts dominate your behavior far more than any attempts to socialize you to human norms.

uplift standard specimen.desc: Though you must deal with prejudice, you are proof of the success of transhumanity's uplift project.

anarchist.desc: You've allied yourself with one of the many anarchist collectives working towards greater freedoms and independence.

argonaut.desc: Scientific progress can be a two-edged sword. The fact that the argonauts embrace both the wonder and the dangers of new technologies and work towards their responsible use is one of the reasons you joined up.

barsoomian.desc: Your times among the rural folk and nomads of Mars convinced you that Mars needs to be liberated from the hypercorps.

belter.desc: You hail from the lawless frontier of the Main Belt, home to miners, pirates, exiles, and outcasts of every stripe.

bioconservative.desc: You think the ideology of transhumanism is dubious and suspect at best, and may in fact pose an extinction threat to  the human species.

brinker.desc: Some folk just aren't all that fond of too many other folk. Being in space and having to live cheek-to-jowl with others makes it kinda hard. Your fellow brinkers understand you need a little 'me space' to go along with 'me time.'

criminal.desc: As long as there are people there will always be rules, and where there are rules there are opportunities to make a tidy profit providing the sorts of things those rules prohibit. You prefer to think of yourself as a facilitator for those who want to get around these restrictions.

europan.desc: You hail from the aquatic depths and under-ice habitats of Europa.

exhuman.desc: You are a supporter of discarding humanity's genetic shackles and elevating yourself to a newer, improved physical form.

extropian.desc: You are an Extropian because you believe in the unfettered potential of transhumanity. Too many saw the Fall as a cautionary tale to slow down or even stop entirely, but you believe that the only way for transhumanity to survive is forwards and upwards to greater things.

hypercorp.desc: The Fall upset the natural ebb and flow of trade and innovation in such a way that transhumanity is just starting to recover. Some fools believe that the Fall was a sign that old systems and practices needed to be changed, but people like a sense of continuity. They like having their consumer goods and regular mesh programming, and that's what the hypercorps give them, a link to a shared human experience.

jovian.desc: You are one of the last remnants of true humanity in the galaxy. The rest of these so-called transhumans have allowed themselves to become corrupted by the machines that brought about the fall of humanity and forced the evacuation of Earth. It is up to you and your fellows to make sure humanity survives.

lunar.desc: Earth's moon is one of the last bastions of Earth culture, where old traditions are still respected. The rest of the system looks to Luna for the latest in trends and fashions, and you are proud to be on the cutting edge of style.

mercurial infolife.desc: You oppose the assimilation of AGIs into transhumanity, believing that each intelligence should forge their own path and culture.

mercurial uplift.desc: You oppose the assimilation of uplifts into transhumanity, believing that each intelligence should forge their own  path and culture.

nano ecologist.desc: You support the use of nanotechnology as a less-invasive means of terraforming and transforming alien worlds.

orbital.desc: Living in orbit above Earth, among a melting pot of transhumanity's displaced cultures, you look down upon a daily reminder of our species' failures.

outster.desc: You are a denizen of the dark depths of space in the outer Kuiper Belt, delving into your own virtual worlds.

precautionist.desc: You adhere to the Precautionary Principle, believing that the only technology to be adopted should be that which is first proven safe.

preservationist.desc: You believe that alien worlds must be protected from contamination and that transhumanity is recklessly despoiling thousands of exoplanets as it expands through the gates.

reclaimer.desc: You are dedicated to rescuing your species' homeworld from the ruin engulfing it.

ringer.desc: You have soared on the solar wind through Saturn's rings and called its many moons your home.

sapient.desc: You support the full assimilation of uplifts and AGIs into transhumanity.

scum.desc: You proudly call the exotic, edgy, and lawless ships of a scum swarm your home.

sifter.desc: You worked the mobile mining operations on Mercury's scorched surface.

singularity seeker.desc: You seek the means to ascend your ego to god-like levels of intelligence, by any means necessary.

skimmer.desc: You have raced the winds in the upper clouds of the ice giants.

socialite.desc: Whether you are an undying oligarch, a young wealthy heir destined never to climb the ladder, or a self-made entrepreneur or celebrity, you love the social life and glitterati spotlight.

solarian.desc: You have skated the magnetic fields in the sun's corona with your pack of surya.

titanian.desc: You consider Titan's technosocialist cyberdemocracy the best path forward for transhumanity's future.

ultimate.desc: You pursue the pinnacles of transhuman achievement, physically, mentally, and spiritually.

venusian.desc: You call the aerostats of the Venusian clouds your home.

academic.desc: You devote your efforts to the pursuit of knowledge.

activist.desc: You fight for a cause that you fervently believe in. You are an active member of a group like the anti-assimilationist mercurials, anti-technology bioconservatives, pro-privacy Datacide, Luna's Steel Liberators, Venus's VTP, Mars's Barsoomians, or Titan's Oligarchs.

assassin.desc: Death doesn't have the impact it used to, but sometimes it's enough to simply get someone out of the way for a little while.

bodyguard.desc: You protect your clients from harm and the stress and inconvenience of death. More often, you protect them from pestering fans, activists, or others that seek their attention.

bot jammer.desc: Why resleeve when you can jam? You can field bots for every situation, like a mechanical puppetmaster.

combat async.desc: Your psi abilities have been honed to a killing edge.

con artist.desc: You excel at working your way into people's confidence and turning that against them.

controller async.desc: Your infection enables you to invade and influence the minds of others.

covert ops.desc: You are skilled at sneaking into places you don't belong for high-threat missions.

dealer.desc: You are a free trader, black marketeer, or hypercorp salesperson. You have what it takes to close the deal.

ego hunter.desc: You specialize in tracking people down who don't want to be found, no matter what morph they are currently sleeved in.

enforcer.desc: In basic terms, you're a thug, no matter if you work for a hypercorp, cartel head, or habitat overseer.

explorer.desc: While others have to wait for months or years to get even a whiff of a Pandora Gate or one of the rare artifacts retrieved by gatecrashers, you've walked on alien worlds and maybe even held alien technology in your own hands.

face.desc: You have what it takes to deal with people and make them think they're getting what they want while you have them wrapped around your finger.

genehacker.desc: You're a biohacker. You meddle with genetics and biotechnology to see what you can create, to improve life and help overcome biological flaws, or simply to keep your biological future in your own hands.

hacker.desc: Processes on the mesh heed your beck and call, whether you seek to penetrate systems or protect them.

icon.desc: You are an artist, x-caster, socialite, or other person who has attracted a fan base.

investigator.desc: Your sleuthing skills include old-school detective work and modern data retrieval. You might be a private investigator, a police detective, or an insurance claim agent.

journo.desc: You are a walking recorder, seeking out the news and broadcasting what you find to the mesh.

pirate.desc: Traveling wasn't something you did because you wanted to see new places and people. More often than not, you needed to skip out of a habitat to avoid arrest. Soon enough, your talent at evading authorities was parlayed into a more profitable career 'liberating' cargo from automated haulers and finding the best place to sell the goods.

psychosurgeon.desc: You help people stay sane and/or be whatever they want to be in their mind.

savant async.desc: Your infection gives you mental abilities beyond the reach of other transhumans.

scanner async.desc: Your mind is altered in a way that provides you with preternatural senses.

scavenger.desc: The universe can be a hard place for those who are too different. This means that many traditional jobs are denied to these kinds of people and they must find other ways of getting by, such as scavenging and taking odd jobs for meager amounts of credit or the promise of a favor later on.

scientist.desc: You seek to understand how the universe works-or at least certain elements of it.

smart animal handler.desc: You raise and care for the smart animals that are a vital part of many transhuman settlements.

smuggler.desc: There is an art to getting unapproved merchandise into and out of high security habitats, and you are a virtuoso. Even inner system habs hold restrictive views on unfettered capitalism. You don't consider yourself a criminal so much as a subtle expediter of market forces, an angel of supply come to make a bargain with the devil of demand.

soldier.desc: You served as a soldier for a pre-Fall nation-state, hypercorp, or habitat polity, or you worked as a mercenary-for-hire-or you simply were forced to take up arms as a conflict erupted around you.

spy.desc: You are a covert agent, skilled at infiltrating the opposition to ferret out secrets or further your own agenda.

techie.desc: You are the person who keeps the machines running-or knows how to shut them down.

thief.desc: You survive by stealing from others, whether by picking pockets or breaking and entering.

wrecker.desc: You are optimized for killing machines. You either excelled at fighting TITAN constructs during the Fall or you continue to  hunt them down in the aftermath.
